response:
Urgent MRI of the spine (and brain) is needed to confirm a thoracic myelopathy, define its extent, and exclude surgically treatable compression. Blood tests should prioritise reversible metabolic causes such as vitamin B12 and copper deficiency and screen for infectious (HIV, syphilis, HTLV-1) and systemic autoimmune aetiologies. CSF analysis and specific antibodies help identify inflammatory demyelinating disorders. Nerve conduction studies are considered if coexistent peripheral neuropathy is suspected. Additional investigations address the chest consolidation and general medical status.
